RPI Robotic Art Installation.description: Art installation for the RPI campus. Will be comprised of several dozen origami units that open and close in response to user stimulus from a computer vision system. Serving as the Team Lead for the project, helping out with programming and electrical work.

Rensselaer Motorsport - RM26.description: Powertrain Lead for Rensselaer Motorsport's first electric vehicle. I worked on decision matrices and design reviews in favor of implementing an EMRAX 228 motor with Cascadia Rinehart PM100DX motor controller for our powertrain. I am currently working on the implementation, control systems, and high voltage routing for this configuration. I am also working on the battery management system for our accumulator battery.

Rensselaer Motorsport - RM25.description: Worked on software and electric systems for Rensselaer Motorsport's 25th Formula SAE car, RM25.

Power Take-Off Gearbox.description: Drop-in replacement for VexPro Three CIM Ball Shifter, while providing independent outputs to two mechanisms. All electronics and pneumatics are located to one side (to prevent interference with wheels and chassis), and the second output is fitted with a power shuttle to reverse output direction (in the case that both outputs run at the same time).

Aquila Heavy.description: Thrust Vector Controlled model rocket using a dual Arduino telemetry and control system. Can recorded flight data like altitude, pitch, yaw, and roll along with camera feed.

ML-CV.description: Hybrid Computer Vision System coded in Python for the 2020/21 FRC game. Utilizes OpenCV algorithms alongside a Transfer Trained MobileNet SSD model for video processing and error correction. Uses Tornado and Websockets for relaying data to the robot and driver.

BlueComms.description: Cross-Computer communication for functions like copy, paste, cut, etc. using Bluetooth. Currently working on designing an installer for the code so that it can run as a background program instead of a script that must be manually executed on machine startup.

HawkEye.description: Computer Vision System coded in Python for the 2020 FRC game. Utilizes OpenCV, Tornado, and Websockets for video processing and relaying data to the robot and driver.

FRC 2601 - 2K20 Robot, Hylo Wren.description: Worked on various software systems with other engineers on the team for FRC Team 2601's 2020 robot.

Swerve Drive.description: Worked on the development of a swerve drivetrain prototype for my FRC team. I designed CAD models for the modules and chassis of a swerve drive. In addition, I developed the control systems for both robot orientated and field orientated control of the swerve.

FRC 2601 - 2K19 Robot, Cygnus.description: Worked on various software systems with other engineers on the team for FRC Team 2601's 2019 robot.

FRC 2601 - 2K18 Robot, Steel Hawking.description: Worked on various software systems with other engineers on the team for FRC Team 2601's 2018 robot.
